A hurricane is coming!" Tim's mom said. "Come inside, Tim!" Tim and his friends went inside their houses to be safe.
The hurricane made a big mess outside. When it was over, Tim and his friends went out to clean up. They picked up sticks and leaves. Tim said, "Let's work together and make our town organized again!" And they did. They loved to help each other and make their town beautiful again.

scared.
A kind squirrel saw Tim and whispered, "Don't be scared, I will help you find your mom." The squirrel led Tim back to his mom. Tim was so happy to see her. He hugged his mom and said, "I am sorry for not listening to you. I will listen next time."
From that day on, Tim learned to listen to his mom. He knew that she only wanted what was best for him. And the moral of the story is to always listen to those who love and care for you.

A little boy saw the bee and thought, "I want to be friends with the bee!" So, the boy let the bee play with the ball. They had so much fun together. They laughed and played all day long.
But then, something unexpected happened. The bee touched the ball and it changed colors! It turned from red to blue. The boy and the bee were very surprised. They found out that when the bee touched things, they changed colors. They had more fun changing colors of many things. And they became best friends forever.

After that day, the people in the town were happy again. They had apples to eat, and they learned that sharing was a good thing. And the helpful girl was a hero to everyone.

A little boy named Tim saw a big red balloon. He wanted to hold it. Tim asked the balloon man, "Can I have the big red balloon, please?" The balloon man said, "Yes, you can, but be careful not to release it!"
Tim held the balloon tight, but then something unexpected happened. A tiny bird flew by and pecked the balloon. "Pop!" The balloon burst, and the bird flew away. Tim was sad, but then he saw a big rainbow in the sky. The rainbow made him smile, and he forgot about the balloon.
